predicate.note: based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'put'

example.name: set at
example.text: Judge Curry set the interest rate on the refund at 9%.
example.arg: the interest rate on the refund

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Judge Curry's order set a precedent for a second nuclear rate case.
example.arg: a precedent for a second nuclear rate case

example.name: all args
example.text: The flow of Japanese funds has set in motion a complex process.

example.name: on your mark, get set, go
example.text: According to one analyst, workers at the Cananea copper mine in Mexico, which hasn't been operating since it was declared bankrupt by the Mexican government in late August, are set [*-3] to return to work.
example.arg: workers at the Cananea copper mine in Mexico, which hasn't been operating since it was declared bankrupt by the Mexican government in late August
example.note: This is properly an adjective but we might as well include it.

example.name: on the road again...
example.text: A disaffected, hard-drinking, nearly-30 hero sets off for snow country in search of an elusive sheep with a start on its back at the behest of a sinister, erudite mobster with a Stanford degree.
example.arg: in search of an elusive sheep with a start on its back at the behest of a sinister, erudite mobster with a Stanford degree

roleset.name: set off: make a bomb explode

example.name: genetic bomb
example.text: He assumed the missing piece contained a gene or genes whose loss *trace-1* had a critical role in *trace-2* setting off the cancer.
example.arg: *trace-2* -> *trace-1* -> whose loss -> a gene or genes

example.name: an offer you can't refuse
example.text: A key provision in the current version of the charter would give the commission a mandate to produce an ``action program'' detailing on what points EC member states would be required to comply with the goals set [*] out in the charter.

example.name: begin travel
example.text: On her husband's 50th birthday (after an auspicious 23 years of marriage, it should be noted), Betsy, Al and their college-bound son set out for New York to visit Fordham University.
example.arg: On her husband's 50th birthday (after an auspicious 23 years of marriage, it should be noted
Betsy, Al, and their college-bound son

example.name: begin a task
example.text: Bioengineers set out [*-1] to duplicate that feat -- scientifically and commercially -- with new life forms.
example.arg: [*-1] to duplicate that feat -- scientifically and commercially -- with new life forms

example.name: set in place
example.text: Kawasaki-Rikuso, a freight company, set up its own software subsidiary this year and is spending nearly a year's profit to more than double the computer terminals at its main office.
